item.title: Report X-2023100029
item.description:
Report X-2023100029

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T15:12:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-09
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Sept 8th, a package was tendered to the ramp. One of the packages in the ULD was a package that contained UN1263, Paint, 3, III, and was completely saturated with from the inner receptacle leaking out. The package also was marked with a ground limited quantity label on the outside and no other markings. The spill was cleaned up and will need to be sent out for disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The previously processed hazmat was discovered and placed in haz cage under hood. DescribePack: Inspection confirmed that there was a ballpoint pen size hole on the top corner of the plastic jerrican. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Placed in cage under hood inside a black tote. Contained movement to help contain release

item.title: Report X-2023090658
item.description:
Report X-2023090658

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T15:12:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-09
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THIS IS A STYROFOAM CONTAINER. ONCE INSPECTED WE FOUND IT BROKE IN HALF AND ONE OF THE CAPS IS BROKEN OFF GLASS CONTAINER. WHEN CONTAINER BROKE IT SPILLED ON PH CAUSING IRRITATION. PACKAGE WAS ON TUGGER GOING TO LOAD SIDE. (SEE ATTACHED DOCS) DescribePack: THE CAP HAD BROKE ON THE GLASS BOTTLE AND CAUSE THE LEAK DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: QA WAS NEAR BY AND HELPED CLEAN UP THE SPILL AND ALSO GET HELP FOR PH

item.title: Report E-2023100247
item.description:
Report E-2023100247

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-12T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 27, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon jug of UN3265 was punctured by a nail and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. . Crews deployed neutralizing granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged 5-gallon jug of corrosive liquid was placed inside one (1) 30-gallon poly drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023100220
item.description:
Report E-2023100220

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-12T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ERTS was contacted by Tim Pfeffer (Roadrunner Transportation Systems) regarding an approx. 1 gallon release of UN1993 - "D-Limonene Standard" on the Bay dock due to a forklift puncture. The caller has requested a contractor out for cleanup and containment. ERTS dispatched Hepaco Environmental personnel. HEPACO confirmed product released as UN1993 - "D-Limonene Standard. Spill is no longer visible as it has evaporated. The drum was turned upside down by onsite staff as an effort to stop the active leak. Hepaco will place the drum in (1) 65-Gal DM overpack. The overpack drum was staged on site pending disposal confirmation.
